body.ab: <milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0134__main__33"/>To Victor Fankenstein <lb n="c57-0134__main__34"/>May<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22215__Start"/>Feb.<del loc="c57-0134__main__d1e22215__End"/> 18 – 17— <lb n="c57-0134__main__35"/>My dearest Friend.<lb n="c57-0135__main__1"/>It gave me the greatest pleasure to <lb n="c57-0135__main__2"/>receive a letter from my Uncle dated at <lb n="c57-0135__main__3"/>Paris. You are no longer at a formidable <lb n="c57-0135__main__4"/>distance and I may hope to see you in <lb n="c57-0135__main__5"/>less than a fortnight. My poor Cousin!<lb n="c57-0135__main__6"/>How much must you have suffered! <lb n="c57-0135__main__7"/>I expect to see you looking even more <lb n="c57-0135__main__8"/>ill than when you quitted Geneva. This <lb n="c57-0135__main__9"/>winter has been passed most miserably <lb n="c57-0135__main__10"/>but although happiness will not shine <lb n="c57-0135__main__11"/>in our eyes for many months yet I <lb n="c57-0135__main__12"/>hope to <metamark>^</metamark>see peace in your countenance & to <lb n="c57-0135__main__13"/>find that your heart is not totally <lb n="c57-0135__main__14"/>devoid of comfort & tranquility.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0135__main__15"/>Yet I fear that<del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22286__Start"/>,<del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22286__End"/> the same feelings <lb n="c57-0135__main__16"/>now exist that made you so miserable <lb n="c57-0135__main__17"/>a year ago even perhaps augmented by time. <lb n="c57-0135__main__18"/>I would not at this period disturb you <lb n="c57-0135__main__19"/>when so many misfortunes weigh upon <lb n="c57-0135__main__20"/>you but a conversation that I had <lb n="c57-0135__main__21"/>with my uncle previous to his departure <lb n="c57-0135__main__22"/>renders some explanation necessary <lb n="c57-0135__main__23"/>before we meet.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0135__main__24"/>Explanation, you may possibly say, <lb n="c57-0135__main__25"/>what can Elizabeth have to explain? <lb n="c57-0135__main__26"/>If you really say this my questions are <lb n="c57-0135__main__27"/>answered and I have no more to do than <lb n="c57-0135__main__28"/>to sign myself your affectionate cousin. <lb n="c57-0135__main__29"/>But you are distant from me &I can <lb n="c57-0135__main__30"/>not it is possible that you may dread &<lb n="c57-0135__main__31"/>yet be pleased with this explanation <lb n="c57-0135__main__32"/><del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22332__Start"/>af<del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22332__End"/>and if such could be the case I <lb n="c57-0135__main__33"/>cannot delay it and <del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22343__Start"/>with<del loc="c57-0135__main__d1e22343__End"/>inthe probability of <lb n="c57-0135__main__34"/>this being the case I dare not postpone <lb n="c57-0135__main__35"/>any longer to write what during your <lb n="c57-0135__main__36"/>absence I have often wished to express to<lb n="c57-0136__main__1"/>to you but have never had courage to begin.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__2"/>You <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>well know, Victor, that <del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22388__Start"/>it<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22388__End"/> our union <lb n="c57-0136__main__3"/>had been the favourite plan of my aunt <lb n="c57-0136__main__4"/>and uncle ever since our infancy–We were <lb n="c57-0136__main__5"/>told this when young and taught to look <lb n="c57-0136__main__6"/>forward to it as an event that would <lb n="c57-0136__main__7"/>certainly take place. We were affectionate <lb n="c57-0136__main__8"/>playfellows during childhood & I beli<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>eve <lb n="c57-0136__main__9"/>dear &<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22421__Start"/>beloved<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22421__End"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>valued friends to one another when <lb n="c57-0136__main__10"/>we grew older. But as a brother & sister <lb n="c57-0136__main__11"/>often entertain a lively affection towards <lb n="c57-0136__main__12"/>one another <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>without desiring a more intimate union may not <del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22451__Start"/>this<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22451__End"/>such also be <lb n="c57-0136__main__13"/>our case. Tell me, dearest Victor, Answer <lb n="c57-0136__main__14"/>me, I conjure you by our mutual happi<lb n="c57-0136__main__15"/>ness, with simple truth do you not love <lb n="c57-0136__main__16"/><del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22473__Start"/>as you would wish to love a wife<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22473__End"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__17"/>another?<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0136__main__18"/>You have travelled, you have spent <lb n="c57-0136__main__19"/><del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22486__Start"/>some<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22486__End"/><lb n="c57-0136__left_margin__1"/>several years of your life at Ingolstadt–&<lb n="c57-0136__main__20"/>I confess to <del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22506__Start"/>m<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22506__End"/> you, my friend that when <lb n="c57-0136__main__21"/>I saw you last Autumn so unhappy <lb n="c57-0136__main__22"/><del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22512__Start"/>& obstinately<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22512__End"/> flying from the society <lb n="c57-0136__main__23"/>of every creature to solitude &despon<lb n="c57-0136__main__24"/>dency I could not help supposing <lb n="c57-0136__main__25"/>that you might regret our connection <lb n="c57-0136__main__26"/>& believe your self bound in honour <lb n="c57-0136__main__27"/>to fulfil the wishes of your parents <lb n="c57-0136__main__28"/>although they opposed themselves to <lb n="c57-0136__main__29"/>your inclinations. But this is false <lb n="c57-0136__main__30"/>resoning. <del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22537__Start"/>I lo<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22537__End"/> I confess to you my <lb n="c57-0136__main__31"/>cousin that I <del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22546__Start"/>have<del loc="c57-0136__main__d1e22546__End"/> love you &<lb n="c57-0136__main__32"/>that in my airy castles of futurity <lb n="c57-0136__main__33"/>you have been my constant friend<lb n="c57-0137__main__1"/>and companion. But it is your hap<lb n="c57-0137__main__2"/>piness I desire as well as my own <del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22566__Start"/>felicity<del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22566__End"/><lb n="c57-0137__main__3"/>when I declare to you that our marriage <lb n="c57-0137__main__4"/>would render me eternally miserable <lb n="c57-0137__main__5"/>unless it were the dictate of your own <lb n="c57-0137__main__6"/>free choice. Even now I weep when I <del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22578__Start"/>co<del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22578__End"/> think <lb n="c57-0137__main__7"/>that borne down as you are by the <lb n="c57-0137__main__8"/>cruellest misfortunes you may stifle <lb n="c57-0137__main__9"/>by the word honor all hope of that <lb n="c57-0137__main__10"/>love & happiness which would alone <lb n="c57-0137__main__11"/><del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22593__Start"/>conduce to your felicity<del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22593__End"/>restore you to yourself. I who have <lb n="c57-0137__main__12"/>so disinterrested an affection for you <lb n="c57-0137__main__13"/>may encrease your miseries tenfold <lb n="c57-0137__main__14"/>by being an obstacle to your wishes <lb n="c57-0137__main__15"/>Ah Victor be assured that yourcou<lb n="c57-0137__main__16"/>sin& playmate has too sincere <lb n="c57-0137__main__17"/>a love for you not to be made <lb n="c57-0137__main__18"/>wretched by this supposition. Be hap<lb n="c57-0137__main__19"/>py my friend and if you obey me in <lb n="c57-0137__main__20"/>this one request be assured that <lb n="c57-0137__main__21"/>nothing on earth will have the power <lb n="c57-0137__main__22"/>to <del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22638__Start"/>disturb.<del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22638__End"/><metamark>^</metamark>interrupt my tranquillity.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0137__main__23"/>Do not let this letter disturb you. <lb n="c57-0137__main__24"/>Do <del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22656__Start"/>y<del loc="c57-0137__main__d1e22656__End"/> not answer it tomorrow or the <lb n="c57-0137__main__25"/>next day or not even untill you <lb n="c57-0137__main__26"/>come if it will give you pain. My <lb n="c57-0137__main__27"/>Uncle will send me news of your <lb n="c57-0137__main__28"/>health and if I see but one smile <lb n="c57-0137__main__29"/>on your lips when we meet occa<lb n="c57-0137__main__30"/>sioned by this letter or any other <lb n="c57-0137__main__31"/>exertion of mine I shall need no <lb n="c57-0137__main__32"/>other happiness– Your affectionate friend <lb n="c57-0137__main__33"/>Elizabeth Lavenza. <lb n="c57-0137__main__34"/>Geneva<lb n="c57-0138__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c57-0138.02" unit="tei:head"/>Chap. 16<lb n="c57-0138__main__2"/>This letter revived in my memory what I had before <lb n="c57-0138__main__3"/>forgotten, the <del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22700__Start"/>mi<del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22700__End"/> threat of fiend when he visited <lb n="c57-0138__main__4"/>me at the Orkney Island. I will be with you<lb n="c57-0138__main__5"/>on your marriage night. Such was my sentence <lb n="c57-0138__main__6"/>and on that night would the dæmon <lb n="c57-0138__main__7"/>employ every art to destroy me & tear me <lb n="c57-0138__main__8"/>from the <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>glimse happiness <del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22741__Start"/>that might<del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22741__End"/>by which it promised partly <lb n="c57-0138__main__9"/>console my sufferings. On that night he <lb n="c57-0138__main__10"/>had determined to consummate his crimes <lb n="c57-0138__main__11"/>by my death. Well be it so. A deadly struggle <lb n="c57-0138__main__12"/>would then assuredly take place where <lb n="c57-0138__main__13"/>if he was victorious I should be at peace <lb n="c57-0138__main__14"/>and his power over me <del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22767__Start"/>was<del loc="c57-0138__main__d1e22767__End"/>be at an end <lb n="c57-0138__main__15"/>If he were vanquished he should I <lb n="c57-0138__main__16"/>and I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>should be a free man — Alas what a <lb n="c57-0138__main__17"/>freedom such as peasant endures <lb n="c57-0138__main__18"/>when his family have been massacred <lb n="c57-0138__main__19"/>before his eyes his cottage burnt his <lb n="c57-0138__main__20"/>lands laid waste & he is turned adrift <lb n="c57-0138__main__21"/>homeless, pennyless & alone: but free. <lb n="c57-0138__main__22"/>Such would be my liberty except that <lb n="c57-0138__main__23"/>in my Elizabeth I possessed a treasure <lb n="c57-0138__main__24"/>alas balanced by the horrors of remorse <lb n="c57-0138__main__25"/>& guilt which would pursue me <lb n="c57-0138__main__26"/>untill death.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0138__main__27"/>Sweet & beloved Elizabeth! I read <lb n="c57-0138__main__28"/>& reread her letter & some softened <lb n="c57-0138__main__29"/>feelings stole in to my heart & dared <lb n="c57-0138__main__30"/>whisper Paradiscical dreams of love <lb n="c57-0138__main__31"/>& joy– But the apple was already <lb n="c57-0138__main__32"/>eaten & the Angels arm bared ready <lb n="c57-0138__main__33"/>to chase me from all hope. Yet I<lb n="c57-0139__main__1"/>would die to make her happy <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22842__Start"/>on whom I<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22842__End"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__2"/>and if the monster ex<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22847__Start"/>c<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22847__End"/>ecuted his threat die <lb n="c57-0139__main__3"/>I must.<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__1"/>death was <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__2"/>inevitable. Yet again I considered whether my marriage <lb n="c57-0139__main__4"/>would hasten my fate if once the fiend had <lb n="c57-0139__main__5"/>determined on my death – It might indeed <metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22887__Start"/>protract<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22887__End"/> hasten a <lb n="c57-0139__main__6"/>few months but if he suspected that I delayed <lb n="c57-0139__main__7"/>it on his account he would certainly revenge <lb n="c57-0139__main__8"/>himself some other way<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__1"/>My destruction <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__2"/>might inded <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__3"/>arrive a few <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__4"/>months sooner <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__5"/>but if my <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__6"/>torturer should <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__7"/>suspect that <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__8"/>I postponed <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__9"/>my marriage <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__10"/>on account of <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__11"/>his menaces <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__12"/>he would surely <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__13"/>find other, &<lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__14"/>perhaps more <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__15"/>dreadful means <lb n="c57-0139__left_margin__16"/>of revenge. He had vowed to<lb n="c57-0139__main__9"/>be with me on my marriage night Yet he <lb n="c57-0139__main__10"/>did not consider that threat as binding <lb n="c57-0139__main__11"/>him to peace in the mean time – for as <lb n="c57-0139__main__12"/>if to shew me that he was not yet <lb n="c57-0139__main__13"/>satiated with blood <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22957__Start"/>his ne<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22957__End"/> he had mur<lb n="c57-0139__main__14"/>dered Cl<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>erval immediately after the enunciation of his theats – After many hours spent <lb n="c57-0139__main__15"/>in reverie & consideration.. I resolved therefore<lb n="c57-0139__main__16"/>that if <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22992__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22992__End"/><del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22997__Start"/>the<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e22997__End"/>my immediate union with <lb n="c57-0139__main__17"/>my cousin swould conduce either to hers or <lb n="c57-0139__main__18"/>my fathers happiness my <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23015__Start"/>threatened<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23015__End"/>adver<lb n="c57-0139__main__19"/>sary's threats against my life should <lb n="c57-0139__main__20"/>not retard it a single hour.–<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__21"/>We returned to Geneva. Elizabeth <lb n="c57-0139__main__22"/>welcome In this state of mind I wrote <lb n="c57-0139__main__23"/>to Elizabeth. My letter was calm and affectio<lb n="c57-0139__main__24"/>nate – I fear, my beloved girl, I said, <lb n="c57-0139__main__25"/>little happiness remains on earth for <lb n="c57-0139__main__26"/>us, yet <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23051__Start"/>what<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23051__End"/>all that I may one day enjoy <lb n="c57-0139__main__27"/>is <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23061__Start"/>all<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23061__End"/> concentered in you. <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23067__Start"/>my beloved one<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23067__End"/><lb n="c57-0139__main__28"/>Chase away your idle fears –To you <lb n="c57-0139__main__29"/>alone do I consecrate my life & my <lb n="c57-0139__main__30"/>endeavours for <del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23077__Start"/>h<del loc="c57-0139__main__d1e23077__End"/> content. I have <lb n="c57-0139__main__31"/>one secret, Elizabeth, a dreadful one— <lb n="c57-0139__main__32"/>It will chill your frame with horror <lb n="c57-0139__main__33"/>and then far from being surprised at<lb n="c57-0140__main__1"/>at my misery you will only wonder that I live. <lb n="c57-0140__main__2"/>I will reveal this tale of misery & terror <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23096__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23096__End"/> to <lb n="c57-0140__main__3"/>you the day after our marriage – for, my <lb n="c57-0140__main__4"/>sweet cousin, we must have perfect confi<lb n="c57-0140__main__5"/>dence between us – But untill then I conjure <lb n="c57-0140__main__6"/>you do not mention or allude to <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23112__Start"/><del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23112__End"/> it. This <lb n="c57-0140__main__7"/>I most <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23119__Start"/>erne<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23119__End"/> earnestly entreat of you&<lb n="c57-0140__main__8"/>I know that you will comply.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0140__main__9"/>In about a week after <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23133__Start"/>this<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23133__End"/>the arrival of Elizabeths letter<lb n="c57-0140__main__10"/>we returned to Geneva. Elizabeth wel<lb n="c57-0140__main__11"/>comed me with warm affection – yet <lb n="c57-0140__main__12"/>tears were in her eyes as she beheld <lb n="c57-0140__main__13"/>my ematiated frame & feverish <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23156__Start"/>eyes<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23156__End"/>cheeks. I <lb n="c57-0140__main__14"/>also saw a change in her—She was thinner <lb n="c57-0140__main__15"/>and had lost much of that heavenly viva<lb n="c57-0140__main__16"/>city that had before charmed me– <lb n="c57-0140__main__17"/>But her softness & gentle looks of com<lb n="c57-0140__main__18"/>passion made her more fit for one <lb n="c57-0140__main__19"/>blasted & miserable as I was.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0140__main__20"/>The calm <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23189__Start"/>hower<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23189__End"/> however which <lb n="c57-0140__main__21"/>I now enjoyed did not last. Recollection <lb n="c57-0140__main__22"/>brought madness with it– And when <lb n="c57-0140__main__23"/>I thought of what had passed a realinsani<lb n="c57-0140__main__24"/>ty possessed me – Sometimes I was furious <lb n="c57-0140__main__25"/>& burnt with rage sometimes low &des<lb n="c57-0140__main__26"/>pondant I neither spoke or looked <lb n="c57-0140__main__27"/>but sat motionless bewildered by the <lb n="c57-0140__main__28"/>multitude of miseries that overcame <lb n="c57-0140__main__29"/>me. Elizabeth alone had the power <lb n="c57-0140__main__30"/>to draw me from these fits – Her gentle <lb n="c57-0140__main__31"/>voice would sooth <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23228__Start"/>m<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23228__End"/> when passionate <lb n="c57-0140__main__32"/>and inspire with <del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23233__Start"/>earthly<del loc="c57-0140__main__d1e23233__End"/> human fee<lb n="c57-0140__main__33"/>lings when sunk in torpor – She wept<lb n="c57-0141__main__1"/>with me and for me. <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23249__Start"/>When unhappy &<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23249__End"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__2"/>When reason returned she would remonstrate <lb n="c57-0141__main__3"/>with me & endeavour to inspire me with <lb n="c57-0141__main__4"/>resignation —Ah it is well for the unfortunate <lb n="c57-0141__main__5"/>to be resigned– But <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23261__Start"/>th<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23261__End"/> for the guilty there is <lb n="c57-0141__main__6"/>no peace: <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23266__Start"/>& tranquillity &<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23266__End"/> the agonies of <lb n="c57-0141__main__7"/>remorse poison the luxury there other<lb n="c57-0141__main__8"/>wise is <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>sometimes found in indulging <metamark function="insert">^</metamark> the excess of grief.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__9"/>Soon after my arrival my father <lb n="c57-0141__main__10"/>spoke of my immediate marriage with <lb n="c57-0141__main__11"/>my cousin. I remained silent.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__12"/>Have you then, said my father <lb n="c57-0141__main__13"/>some other attachment<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__14"/>None on earth <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23315__Start"/>I replied<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23315__End"/> I love Eliza<lb n="c57-0141__main__15"/>beth and look forward to our union <lb n="c57-0141__main__16"/>with delight—Let the day therefore be <lb n="c57-0141__main__17"/>named and I shall be happy when it <lb n="c57-0141__main__18"/>arrives and on it I will consecrate <lb n="c57-0141__main__19"/>my life or death to the happiness <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23337__Start"/>to<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23337__End"/> of <lb n="c57-0141__main__20"/>my cousin.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__21"/>My dear Victor,<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23347__Start"/>said my father,<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23347__End"/><lb n="c57-0141__main__22"/>do not speak thus. Heavy misfortunes <lb n="c57-0141__main__23"/>have befallen us but let <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23355__Start"/>us<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23355__End"/> us only <lb n="c57-0141__main__24"/>cling closer to what remains <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23360__Start"/>and<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23360__End"/> and <lb n="c57-0141__main__25"/>transfer our love for those whom <lb n="c57-0141__main__26"/>we have lost to those who <del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23376__Start"/>now<del loc="c57-0141__main__d1e23376__End"/>yet live. <lb n="c57-0141__main__27"/>Our
